block.p: Natalie Lucie Fiebrich, a daughter of Christiane Fiebrich and Dr. Rolf-Dieter Fiebrich of Newport Beach, Calif., was married last evening to Daniel Hunt Clare IV, the son of Gwen Cavanagh Clare, the United States ambassador to Ecuador, and Daniel Hunt Clare III of Quito, Ecuador, and Hilton Head, S.C. The Rev. Calvin Genzel, a United Church of Christ minister, performed the ceremony at the Old South Church in Boston. The Rev. Charles B. Hardwick, a Presbyterian minister, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Clare, 26, is a consultant with Bain & Company, strategy consultants in Boston. She graduated from Brown University. Her father is the vice president for engineering at Voyan Technology of Santa Clara, Calif., which designs software for communications networks.

Natalie Lucie Fiebrich, a daughter of Christiane Fiebrich and Dr. Rolf-Dieter Fiebrich of Newport Beach, Calif., was married last evening to Daniel Hunt Clare IV, the son of Gwen Cavanagh Clare, the United States ambassador to Ecuador, and Daniel Hunt Clare III of Quito, Ecuador, and Hilton Head, S.C. The Rev. Calvin Genzel, a United Church of Christ minister, performed the ceremony at the Old South Church in Boston. The Rev. Charles B. Hardwick, a Presbyterian minister, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Clare, 26, is a consultant with Bain & Company, strategy consultants in Boston. She graduated from Brown University. Her father is the vice president for engineering at Voyan Technology of Santa Clara, Calif., which designs software for communications networks.

Mr. Clare, 28, is an associate with an investment fund at Credit Suisse First Boston in New York. He graduated from Haverford College and received an M.B.A. degree from Harvard University. His father retired as the executive assistant to the under secretary for security assistance, science and technology at the State Department in Washington.
